events.name: Imaging User Group Meeting
events.description:
Join us for the Imaging User Group Meeting on 27th March 2017. We will section cellular imaging and tissue imaging in this seminar with various speakers from A*STAR Institutes, Singapore General Hospital, Cancer Science Institute of Singapore and Institut Pasteur Korea.
PerkinElmer Launches Vectra® Polaris™ Automated Quantitative Pathology Imaging System. This new multi-modal tissue imaging system enables researchers to gain a deeper level of understanding of disease mechanisms related to new cancer immunotherapy approaches. The Vectra Polaris system is part of PerkinElmer's Phenoptics™  workflow solution for quantitative pathology research, which enables exploration of the interaction between tumours and immune cells to obtain a deeper understanding of disease mechanisms.
With the release of the Opera Phenix (2015), Operetta CLS (2016) and Vectra Polaris (2017), PerkinElmer (PKI) continues to innovate at the leading edge of quantitative cellular and tissue imaging. By providing state of the art hardware and software, PerkinElmer strives to develop tools researchers can use to generate ground breaking discoveries in translational research in precision medicine, infectious disease, drug discovery and immuno-oncology. Today we will see how quantitative imaging is being used to answer complex biological questions. It is also a time to share ideas and build new connections as we work together towards our goal of improving human health.
So, come join us and RSVP now! *Refreshment will be provided.
events.location: Genome Institute of Singapore, 60 Biopolis Street, Level 2, Seminar Room, Singapore 138672

events.name: TIBCO NOW 2017
events.description: Digital. Smarter Elevating discussion topics from TIBCO NOW 2016, this year’s event will take digital transformation—a top priority for many businesses in 2017—and make it smarter. From interconnecting everything to augmenting intelligence, every aspect of business technology will need to evolve and become sharper in order to remain relevant in today’s fast-paced industry. Attendees will learn first-hand what practices can support their companies and help navigate successful digital transformations, from both a technical, strategic, and leadership standpoint. Expanding the TIBCO NOW event to a global scale will allow conference goers the opportunity to hear regional expert insights on the tools and critical elements required for their individual success. Agenda • 2:00 PM–4:45 PM / Monday, March 27 / Certification, Sessions and Training  • 4:45 PM–5:45 PM / Monday, March 27 / Partner Reception  • 5:45 PM–7:45 PM / Monday, March 27 / Networking Reception  • 8:30 AM–5:00 PM / Tuesday, March 28 / TIBCO NOW Keynote Sessions and Breakouts  • 5:30 PM–7:30 PM / Tuesday, March 28 / Cocktail Reception  View the agenda online. To register, please go to http://now.tibco.com/
events.location: Marina Bay Sands, Marina Bay Sands, Singapore

events.name: Social Coding
events.description: A space for women coders to learn from each other, to practice and discuss learnings with fellow peers. This would be a weekly event of informal space to do coding. So bring your pet projects along or join one of our existing teams/ projects to work on. Featured Projects:https://trello.com/b/kl2BTwil/wwc-sg-social-coding-projects Newbies Step-by-step Guide Please bring your own laptop. Agenda:6:45p - Introduce projects from members6:55p - Break out into groups7:00p - Start coding! ^_^8:30p - End session There is no food provided, so please make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, we recommend to bring your own water bottle along. Psst, this event is intended for ladies only. Host:
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre

events.name: Book Club: From NAND to Tetris II – High-Level Language
events.description: Read The Elements of of Computing Systems and/or follow the Coursera course Build a Modern Computer from First Principles: From Nand to Tetris Part II.  This week we'll be covering chapter 9 High-Level Language (week 3 of the course) and the project from chapter 8 / week 2.  "I did the coursework because understanding computers is important to me, just like literacy and numeracy, and I made it through. I never worked harder on anything, never been challenged to this degree. But given what I now feel capable of doing, I would certainly do it again. To anyone considering NAND2Tetris, it's a tough journey, but you'll be profoundly changed." Shimon Schocken, the author of the book talks about the course at TED: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iE7YRHxwoDs How Book Club Works1. Read the chapter and try out (better yet, complete) this week's course homework before you come to the meetup.2. Find something in the chapter you found interesting and maybe research it a little more.3. At the meetup, we go around the room and each person gets a chance to tell the group about the thing they found interesting.4. Group discussion and banter ensues! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore  437032Singapore Doors open at 7:00, meetup starts at 7:30. Bring snacks and drinks of your choice!  FAQ Do I have to take Nand to Tetris Part I before taking Nand to Tetris Part II? From the Coursera course FAQ: "Nand to Tetris Part I and Nand to Tetris Part II are two separate and stand alone courses. Although it is recommended to take Part I before taking Part II, you can take any of these courses, in any order that suites you." Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS bookclub gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions/bookclub Useful Links • NAND to Tetris website: http://www.nand2tetris.org/ • Get the book: http://www.amazon.com/Elements-Computing-Systems-Building-Principles/dp/0262640686/ • Coursera course: https://www.coursera.org/learn/nand2tetris2
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore
